title: Grill-Roasted Coke- and Pineapple-Glazed Ham Recipe
full_text:
Grill-Roasted Coke- and Pineapple-Glazed Ham Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
3 hrs 10 mins
Active
30 mins
Resting Time
15 mins
Total
3 hrs 30 mins
Serves
12
to 16 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
cup
brown sugar
1
cup
Coke
1
cup
pineapple juice
1/2
cup
ketchup
1/4
cup
honey
2
tablespoons
apple cider vinegar
1
tablespoon
soy sauce
1
spiral sliced city
ham
,
shank end
,
6 to 8
pounds
Directions
To make the glaze:
Combine brown sugar, Coke, pineapple juice, ketchup, honey, vinegar, and soy sauce in a medium sauce pan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce to a simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally until thickened to a syrupy consistency, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Fire up
smoker
or
grill
to 250°F (120°C). Wrap ham in heavy duty aluminum foil and place on smoked. Cover and cook until an instant read thermometer registers 100°F (38°C) when inserted into thickest part of ham, about 2 hours.
Unwrap ham and brush liberally with glaze. Cover and continue to cook for 15 minutes. Brush ham with glaze a second time, cover, and continue to cook until an instant read thermometer registers 120°F (48°C) when inserted into thickest portion of ham, about 15 minutes more. Remove ham from smoker, let rest for 15 minutes, then serve.
Special Equipment
Smoker or grill
